_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FARMERS UNION OIL COMPANY
                   WILDROSE, NORTH DAKOTA
                              
                 EPA - RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN
                      EXECUTIVE SUMMARY


THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH, AND IS OUR POLICY TO ADHERE TO
ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL LAWS REGULATING THE
STORAGE AND SALE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF AN EMERGENCY WERE
TO OCCUR, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE WILDROSE FIRE
PROTECTION DISTRICT AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE
EMERGENCY.

THIS FACILITY IS AN ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE PLANT. WE HAVE
A STORAGE TANK, WHICH WE USE TO FILL NURSE TANKS FOR RETAIL
USE, FOR LOCAL FARMERS.

OUR WORST CASE SCENERIO WOULD BE FAILURE OF OUR BULK STORAGE
TANK WHEN FILLED TO THE GREATEST AMOUNT ALLOWED, RESULTING
IN A GAS RELEASE. ACCORDING TO THE EPA LOOK-UP TABLES, THE
DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT IS 4.4 MILES. OUR LOCATION IS ABOUT
1 MILE FROM THE CITY LIMITS OF WILDROSE, ND.

THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL
CODES AND REGULATIONS INVOLVING ACCIDENT PREVENTION AND
MAINTENANCE. OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA BULK TANK IS DESIGNED,
INSTALLED, AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL STATE AND
FEDERAL LAWS.

WE HAVE NEVER HAD AN ACCIDENT INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA
THAT HAS CAUSED DEATH, INJURY, PROPERTY, OR ENVIRONMENTAL
DAMAGE, EVACUATIONS, OR SHELTERINGS IN PLACE.

IN THE EVENT OR AN EMERGENCY INVOVLING OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA
SYSTEM, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE WILDROSE FIRE
PROTECTION DISTRICT AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE
EMERGENCY. WE HAVE DISCUSSED THIS POLICY WITH THE WILDROSE
FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT, AND THEIR MEMBERS HAVE INSPECTED
OUR PLANT, AND HAVE BEEN TRAINED ON PROCEDURES TO FOLLOW IF
AN EMERGENCY WERE TO OCCUR.
